articles.author: Jamie Carter
articles.title: Space photo of the week: Hubble spies a spectacular galaxy crash - Livescience.com
articles.description: Arp 107 hosts a special spiraling 'Seyfert' galaxy connected to a smaller galaxy by a 'bridge' of dust and gas.
articles.content:
What it is: Arp 107, a pair of galaxies mid-collision.
When it was taken: Sept. 18, 2023.
Where it is: 465 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Leo Minor. 
Why it's so special: This… [+1606 chars]

articles.title: Alien life in Universe: Scientists say finding it is 'only a matter of time' - BBC
articles.description: Experts are optimistic of detecting life signs on a faraway world within our lifetimes - possibly in the next few years.
articles.content:
Many astronomers are no longer asking whether there is life elsewhere in the Universe. 
The question on their minds is instead: when will we find it?
